subject: Productivity
title: The Wisdom of Crowds
description: Learn The Wisdom of Crowds in one minute.

hook.text: Ask one person to guess a cow's weight and they'll be way off. Average 800 guesses and it's eerily precise.

buildup.text: James Surowiecki's book showed that diverse, independent groups outperform individual experts.

discovery.text: The wisdom of crowds works when opinions are independent, diverse, decentralized, and aggregated.

twist.text: Remove independence â€” let people see each other's answers â€” and the wisdom collapses into herding.

climax.text: Smart group decisions require structure. Without it, crowds become mobs, not oracles.

punchline.text: Crowds are wise only when each voice thinks alone.

quiz.question: What conditions make the wisdom of crowds work?
options: Everyone agreeing on the same answer
A single expert guiding the group
